ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Measurement period for INRS/TISPS responses at this time point
Notes: e.g., Past Month, Past Week, Since Last Visit

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner is proud of who I am, including my trans/nonbinary identity
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner gives me compliments about my gender expression
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner loves how I express my gender identity
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner sees my gender exactly as I want them to see it
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner sees my gender as legitimate, no matter what other people think
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: Sometimes I question how much my partner believes in my gender identity
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner would take my gender identity more seriously if I were more masculine or feminine
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If I had questions about my gender identity, my partner would help me think through them
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If I were questioning something about my gender identity, my partner would be glad to discuss it
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My relationship would be a safe space to try out a new name or pronouns in the future
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: When I share new thoughts about my gender, my partner is excited to hear them
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If someone referred to my gender incorrectly, my partner would do something about it
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner would speak up if people made prejudiced comments about trans/nonbinary people, as long as it was safe to do so
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If we had a conflict with my partner's family about my gender identity, my partner would stand up for me
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If I had a conflict with my family related to being trans/nonbinary, my partner would help me deal with it
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: When I talk about being trans/nonbinary with my partner, they usually get what I mean
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner doesn't really understand how prejudice against trans/nonbinary people affects me
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: There are things about my gender identity I don't discuss with my partner because they probably wouldn't understand
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: My partner doesn't fully understand my experiences with being trans/nonbinary
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If I experienced discrimination due to being trans/nonbinary, my partner would take it seriously
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If I told my partner about prejudice I experienced as a result of being trans/nonbinary, they might think I was making a big deal out of nothing
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: If my partner knew something related to being trans/nonbinary made me feel bad, they would be careful not to do it
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Thinking about your relationship with (partner nickname/initial) over the past (measurement period), please think about each of the following statements and mark how much you agree or disagree: Sometimes my partner says things about my gender identity that they know will make me feel bad
Notes: 0 = Strongly disagree; 1 = Somewhat disagree; 2 = Slightly disagree; 3 = Slightly agree; 4 = Somewhat agree; 5 = Strongly agree

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Regard subscale score
Notes: Subscale scores are calculated as the mean of all subscale items

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Validation subscale score
Notes: Subscale scores are calculated as the mean of all subscale items

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Support for Exploration subscale score
Notes: Subscale scores are calculated as the mean of all subscale items

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Stigma Buffering subscale score
Notes: Subscale scores are calculated as the mean of all subscale items

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Understanding subscale score
Notes: Subscale scores are calculated as the mean of all subscale items

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Undermining subscale score
Notes: Subscale scores are calculated as the mean of all subscale items

ElementDescription: Identity Needs in Relationships Scale: Total score after reversing Undermining subscale
Notes: Total scale scores may also be calculated after reverse scoring the ''Undermining'' subscale items

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes how you think of yourself?
Notes: 0 = Cisgender (not transgender or nonbinary); 1 = Transgender (but not nonbinary); 2 = Nonbinary (but not transgender); 3 = Both transgender and nonbinary; 4 = None of these options describe me

ElementDescription: How do you describe your romantic orientation (e.g., biromantic, aromantic, gay, heteroromantic, questioning, not sure)?
Notes: (Write-in response)

ElementDescription: Are you currently in a romantic relationship with this partner?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = It's complicated

ElementDescription: How long have you been (or were you) in a romantic relationship with that partner? Please estimate if you're not sure.
Notes: (Write-in response, with unit specified as ''months'')

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes your legal relationship with that partner?
Notes: 0 = Currently or formerly married; 1 = Currently or formerly in a registered domestic partnership (but not married); 2 = No legal relationship recognition; 3 = Something else

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes you at the beginning of this relationship?
Notes: 0 = When this relationship started, I did not know that I was trans/nonbinary; 1 = When this relationship started, I was questioning whether I was trans/nonbinary; 2 = When this relationship started, I knew I was trans/nonbinary; 3 = Something else

ElementDescription: Thinking about the beginning of this relationship, would you say this partner...
Notes: 0 = Definitely did not know you were (questioning whether you were) trans/nonbinary; 1 = Might have known or guessed you were (questioning whether you were) trans/nonbinary; 2 = Definitely knew you were (questioning whether you were) trans/nonbinary; 3 = Something else

ElementDescription: Does this partner identify as transgender and/or nonbinary?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 2 = It's complicated

ElementDescription: As far as you know, how does that partner identify now, in terms of their gender?
Notes: (Write-in response)

ElementDescription: As far as you know, how did that partner identify in terms of their gender at the time your romantic relationship ended?
Notes: (Write-in response, displayed only if relationship_current is "No")

ElementDescription: What is your gender? specify
What is your sexual orientation?
Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Total score
Notes: Mean of all subscales tisps_celebration_mean, tisps_validation_mean, tisps_allyship_mean, tisps_understanding_mean EXCEPT tisps_undermining_mean

ElementDescription: Description of person or group of people about whom participant is answering questions
Notes: e.g., Partner 1, Friend 2, neighbors

ElementDescription: Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Celebration subscale score
Notes: Mean of items inrsrev_regard_01-03

ElementDescription: Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Validation subscale score
Notes: Mean of items inrsrev_valida_01-04 after reverse-scoring inrsrev_valida_03 and 04

ElementDescription: Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Facilitation subscale score
Notes: Mean of items inrsrev_explor_01-04

ElementDescription: Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Allyship subscale score
Notes: Mean of items inrsrev_buffer_01-04

ElementDescription: Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Understanding subscale score
Notes: Mean of items inrsrev_unders_01-04 after reverse-scoring inrsrev_unders_02-04

ElementDescription: Transgender Identity Support from Partners Scale (TISPS): Undermining subscale score
Notes: Mean of items inrsrev_underm_01-04 after reverse-scoring inrsrev_underm_02 and 04
